title: How Mass. lawmakers are reacting to the deal that could end the government shutdown
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts lawmakers criticize Senate deal ending shutdown, faulting lack of health care subsidy provisions.
Sen. Ed Markey and Sen. Elizabeth Warren oppose deal, emphasizing risk of increased health costs.
Reps. Moulton, Pressley, and Clark plan to vote against, citing insufficient support for working families.

title: Boston firefighters battle 2-alarm blaze at multi-family home in Dorchester
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston Fire Department extinguished a two-alarm fire at 25 Train St. in Dorchester by 9:30 a.m. Tuesday.
The fire displaced two residents and caused an estimated $500,000 in damages.
One firefighter was hospitalized; the fire's cause is under investigation by the Boston Fire Investigation Unit.

title: Here’s what Jon Stewart had to say about the Senate Democrats voting to end the shutdown
author: John Waller
bullets: Jon Stewart criticized Senate Democrats for their handling of the government shutdown vote.
Stewart described the Democrats' decision as a 'world class collapse' in his remarks.
The Senate took initial steps to end the federal government shutdown with new legislation.

title: Patrice Bergeron was asked about possible 2026 Hall of Fame induction
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Former Bruins captain Patrice Bergeron remains humble about his potential 2026 Hockey Hall of Fame induction.
Bergeron retired in 2023 after a 19-season NHL career, winning six Selke Trophies and two Olympic golds.
Bergeron supported Zdeno Chara's Hall of Fame induction, praising Chara's leadership during their time in Boston.

title: Boston police ask for help in search for missing 15-year-old
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: 15-year-old Briyana Jacques was last seen in Dorchester, reportedly near Ashmont station and 1300 Blue Hill Ave on Saturday.
Briyana Jacques is 5'5", with brown hair, blonde highlights, a nose piercing, last wearing a black jacket and grey sweatpants.
Boston police urge anyone with information on Briyana Jacques' whereabouts to call 911 or 617-343-4712.

title: Struggling military families ask Globe Santa for help
author: Linda Matchan
bullets: Military families are increasingly reaching out to Globe Santa for assistance due to financial difficulties during the holiday season.
Many service members struggle financially, with some relying on food stamps and taking multiple jobs to cover expenses.
The high cost of living in Massachusetts and recent government shutdown have exacerbated financial challenges for military families.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about Tuesday’s wind chill, potential for flurries
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Boston faces unseasonably cold and windy conditions with wind chills in the 20s, according to the National Weather Service.
NWS forecasts brief passing flurries or snow showers, with minor accumulations expected in the Berkshires.
Wind gusts may exceed 30 mph today, with temperatures struggling to reach 40°F in Boston, say local meteorologists.

title: Love Letters notes on Veterans Day
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: 'Love Letters' by Meredith Goldstein takes a break for Veterans Day.
Upcoming Globe Summit featuring an exclusive event with author Elin Hilderbrand announced.
Latest Love Letters podcast episode features a conversation with sports columnist Christopher L. Gasper.

title: After loss to Warren, Republican John Deaton announces another run for Senate
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Republican John Deaton announces Senate run against Ed Markey after losing to Elizabeth Warren.
Deaton, a Marine veteran and lawyer, emphasizes his youth and energy in a new campaign video.
Deaton is the first Republican to enter the 2026 race, focusing on economic and political issues.

title: What will the Red Sox target this offseason? Craig Breslow maps out Boston’s priorities.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox eye a top pitcher to pair with Garrett Crochet, looking at trade or free-agent options like Dylan Cease.
Boston seeks to add power to lineup; potential targets include Kyle Schwarber and Pete Alonso as free agents.
Red Sox plan to balance immediate postseason contention with future prospects development, per Craig Breslow.
